Muse
Breathe life into your every thought.
Fun Fact:
Muse Built this Slide Deck*
*Muse built the v1 for the deck. We subsequently polished it and added images.

Problem: Notes are Thought Graves
Inspiration doesn’t wait.
Humans have ~6,200 thoughts/day, many when we’re unprepared to record.
72% report having ephemeral ideas (i.e., “shower thoughts”).
<2% of thoughts are captured in any form (notes, Google/ChatGPT queries, etc.).
Recorded ideas simply wither.
Notes are rarely revisited; ~1% of saved content is used later.
Reviewing old notes is like “sifting through stale garbage.”
Important insights end up buried in unorganized heaps, never to be seen or used again.
Productivity costs: the time tax.
The average employee wastes ~1.8 hrs per workday looking for info they’ve already seen.
As much as 50% of the workweek can be spent re-finding notes/files.
The Cost: ~$3,900 per employee per year. (lost time, duplicated work, missed opportunities)

Sources
1 Queens, 2020; 2 Hansgrohe, 2015; 3 Guay, 2022; 4 Shipper, 2022; 5 McKinsey, 2012; 6 Gartner, 2013

How it works
Contextual Understanding
Beyond keyword search: Smart Surfacing.
Muse understands the “why” behind both your query and your notes for augmented retrieval.
Analyzes each note in relation to each other, auto-connecting your knowledge base.

Content Generation
Proactively creates deliverables: folders of documents, YouTube playlists, slide decks (like this one!), flashcards, calendar events, etc.
Expands half-formed thoughts into fuller concepts, synthesizes insights by merging related notes, and structures raw data into readable content.

Solution: Muse, a Thought Garden
Muse is an extension of your mind.
Beyond storage — it understands, connects, and works with your notes, transforming passive capture into proactive knowledge creation.
Muse uses proprietary LLMs and user-specific embeddings to build a private, ever-evolving knowledge graph that gets smarter with every interaction.
